Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2012 07:29AM KRCornett wrote: I probably can't relate because it seems that you are grappling with a multi-layered set of issues and I'm so sorry.  But I am a 42 year old mother of 3 with no history now looking at a mastecomy on the 27th (with expanders).  I'm not really weepy about the whole thing because my level of denial is so high I just can't really get my head around it. It took me almost a month to even google 'breast cancer.'   Surgery is a little over a week away and I can't even bring myself to tell my parents. My only pep talk (to both of us) is that we fight hard and with dignity for our girls; my daughter is in 3rd grade.  All the best to you.
Posts.Title: 40yr old with Lupus, Now Cancer =[ JMP287 angie27

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2012 09:46AM KRCornett wrote: Tomorrow its a week and these drains are running slow so I'm hopeful they are coming out and it will just be me and the shoe horn in my chest!  Starting to look for the path results but no signs of them yet.  One doctor has told me that there is a 0% chance of no chemo (because of age primarily - I'm 42) -- does anyone ever get a good path report and be told chemo is unnecessary? Best wishes to all!
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2012 03:15PM KRCornett wrote: Hello Friends in the October line up: I am home and doing well after my BMX on the 17th. The discomfort with the expanders has been manageable although my arm feels very "tingly" like the circulation is partially cut off. I am thankful to be home and hoping for good results from the pathology this week. My entire neighborhood now knows I have the 'c' word so I am now explaining over and over to relative strangers how I am "doing ". The well intentioned concern is both welcome and appreciated and not. Does that sound horrid and ungrateful? I don't mean it to be but part of me isn't eager to talk to people at the bus stop about this. So the humorous moment of the week came from Jordan, a 6 year old classmate of my son, who reported my condition to her mom with this description. " Graham's mom got mold her in her mouth and it spread to her breast so they are going to cut it off. But it's ok, because they are going to replace it with a fake breast that is firmer and that's good." I laughed so hard my bad side hurt. All the best to all of you.
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2012 08:45PM KRCornett wrote: Hello, I would like to join the October line up.  I'm scheduled for a left mastectomy with reconstruction on the 17th.  My tumor is about 2cm.  Can anyone tell me if I'm crazy thinking that I'm feeling this thing growing and burning?  It's quite possible this is all in my mind as I obsess about this mass inside me.  But I swear I'm feeling it change and I'm worried. Is it in my head? Sending prayers for courage and good health to all in the October queue.
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2012 06:38PM KRCornett wrote: So I'm not far ahead of you.  Diagnosed 2 weeks ago.  42, a mother of 3, a regular runner and long time vegetarian with no family history...actually no history of ANYTHING. I'm looking at a masectomy in a couple of weeks.  This is so bizarre I'm almost in complete denial.  Never been in a chat room like this before.... Can anyone tell me, can you feel this thing growing because I swear I can and I'm totally freaked out.  I really can't do surgery until early October due to work commitments and I'm totally afraid this is seeping into my lypmph nodes which at this point the MRI shows as clear.  All the best to both of us.
Posts.Title: In shock bennymuffins websister

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2012 02:55AM KRCornett wrote: All of this is still greek to me.  But it's a 1.8MM tumor; I am ER+/PR+ and HER2- (I think that's right).  The MRI was clear for other tumors.  I have small breasts and because of the location of the tumor, a lumpectomy isn't possible.  Because of that, no radiation but chemo after.  When does the Tamoxifen start? I was diagnosed about 3 weeks ago and want to delay surgery until early October so I can "clear the decks" at work.  But now I feel a slight burning sensation in that breast (could totally be in my head because I'm thinking about it all the time) and wondering if this thing is on the march toward my lymph nodes.  All likely imaginary.... The surgeon called it stage 2 grade 2 (this was before the MRI) -- said it was "garden variety".  Thanks for the input.
Posts.Title: In shock bennymuffins websister
